This O
project O
is O
actually O
a O
redesign O
of O
an O
existing O
client O
website O
. O
The O
client O
website O
was O
designed O

on O
Java O
Server O
Pages O
( O
JSP O
) O
and O
our O
aim O
was O
to O
change O
it O
into O
a O
more O
dynamic O
web O
page O
using O

Adobe O
Flex O
. O
At O
first O
we O
changed O
the O
home O
page O
screen O
of O
the O
client O
website O
. O
After O
the O
successful O

completion O
of O
that O
we O
incorporated O
flex O
in O
to O
the O
account O
section O
also O
. O
This O
data O
which O
is O
obtained O

from O
DataBase O
is O
taken O
by O
the O
flex O
using O
a O
remote O
procedure O
call O
and O
the O
data O
is O
shown O
to O
the O

user O
. O
With O
the O
use O
of O
Advanced O
Data O
Grids O
, O
Charts(including O
Bar O
and O
Pie O
Charts O
) O
the O
site O
increased O

the O
readability O
and O
understandability O
of O
the O
users O
who O
were O
previously O
using O
the O
pages O
on O
java O

server O
pages O
. O
This O
site O
developed O
by O
us O
won O
the O
IMC O
( O
Interactive O
Media O
Council O
) O
's O
outstanding O

achievement O
award O
in O
Financial O
information O
. O
The O
judge O
evaluate O
website O
based O
on O
5 O
criteria O
: O

Design O
, O
Content O
, O
Feature O
Functionality O
, O

and O
Standard O
Compliance O
. O
Our O
website O
scored O

475 O
out O
of O
a O
maximum O
of O
500 O
points O
. O

Description O
: O
Development O
of O
Basel O
II O
Application O
, O
Basel O
II O
is O
the O
second O
of O
the O
Basel O
Accords O
, O

which O
are O
recommendations O
on O
banking O
laws O
and O
regulations O
issued O
by O
the O
Basel O
Committee O
on O

Banking O
Supervision O
. O
The O
purpose O
of O
Basel O
II O
, O
which O
was O
initially O
published O
in O
June O
2004 O
, O
is O
to O

create O
an O
international O
standard O
that O
banking O
regulators O
can O
use O
when O
creating O
regulations O
about O

how O
much O
capital O
banks O
need O
to O
put O
aside O
to O
guard O
against O
the O
types O
of O
financial O
and O
operational O

risks O
banks O
face O
. O
In O
practice O
, O
Basel O
II O
attempts O
to O
accomplish O
this O
by O
setting O
up O
rigorous O
risk O

and O
capital O
management O
requirements O
designed O
to O
ensure O
that O
a O
bank O
holds O
capital O
reserves O

appropriate O
to O
the O
risk O
the O
bank O
exposes O
itself O
to O
through O
its O
lending O
and O
investment O
practices O
. O

The O
New O
Accord O
includes O
several O
methodologies O
for O
determining O
a O
bank O
's O
risk O
- O
based O
capital O

requirements O
for O
credit O
, O
market O
and O
operational O
risk O
. O
For O
Risk O
Based O
Capital O
( O
RBC O
) O
, O
Credit O
Usage O

( O
CU O
) O
and O
Stress O
Test O
( O
ST O
) O
, O
the O
methodologies O
that O
will O
be O
used O
for O
repo O
style O
transactions O
are O

Simple O
VaR O
if O
the O
collateral O
is O
eligible O
. O
If O
the O
collateral O
is O
ineligible O
then O
the O
Wholesale O
loan O

approach O
will O
be O
utilized O
or O
the O
collateral O
will O
be O
reduced O
to O
zero O
in O
the O
Simple O
VaR. O

. O

Roles O
and O
Responsibilities O
: O
Development O
, O
Testing O
and O
support O
. O

Software O
Used O
: O
Oracle O
9i O

December Duration

Present Duration

BT O
Openreach O
( O
British O
Telecom O
) O

BT O
Openreach O
is O
responsible O
for O
looking O
after O
the O
local O
network O
( O
connection O
from O
your O
property O

to O
local O
exchange O
) O
that O
makes O
the O
running O
of O
telecommunication O
services O
possible O
. O
BT O
helps O
to O

provide O
lines O
for O
telephone O
connection O
. O
It O
has O
products O
like O
PSTN O
, O
Ethernet O
, O
NGA O
, O
and O
LLU O
. O
BT O
acts O

as O
an O
intermediate O
between O
customer O
and O
connection O
provider O
. O

BT O
Openreach O
is O

STP O
is O
basically O
a O
router O
that O
realys O
ss7 O
messages O
through O
various O
signally O
points O
. O
In O
project O
all O

STPs O
were O
replaced O
by O
ORACLE O
STP O
due O
to O
its O
advanced O
features O
, O
high O
end O
support O
, O
flexibility O
. O

The O
STP O
is O
connected O
to O
adjacent O
SEPs O
and O
STPs O
via O
signaling O
links O
. O
Based O
on O
the O
address O
fields O

of O
the O
SS7 O
messages O
, O
the O
STP O
routes O
the O
messages O
to O
the O
appropriate O
outgoing O
signaling O
link O
. O

Stamp O
Duty O
means O
a O
tax O
payable O
on O
certain O
legal O
documents O
specified O
by O
statute O
; O
the O
duty O
may O

be O
fixed O
or O
ad O
valorem O
meaning O
that O
the O
tax O
paid O
as O
a O
stamp O
duty O
may O
be O
a O
fixed O
amount O
or O

an O
amount O
which O
varies O
based O
on O
the O
value O
of O
the O
products O
, O
services O
or O
property O
on O
which O
it O
is O

levied O
. O

is O
basically O
a O
kind O
of O
tax O
paid O
on O

based O
on O

of O
documents O

PMJJ O
BY O
: O
PMJJBY O
( O
Pradhan O
Mantri O
Jeevan O
Jyoti O
Bima O
Yojana O
) O
is O
a O
one O
year O
Life O
insurance O
scheme O
, O

auto O
renewed O
every O
year O
, O
offering O
coverage O
for O
death O
due O
to O
any O
reason O
. O
The O
PMJJBY O
scheme O
is O

available O
to O
anyone O
between O
18 O
and O
50 O

Description O
: O

CSPC O
is O
a O
collector O
which O
is O
integrated O
with O
different O
CSOs O
( O
Common O
Service O
Objects O
) O
like O
the O

device O
discovery O
CSO O
, O
core O
collection O
, O
connectivity O
and O
data O
normalization O
. O
Together O
we O
call O
as O

CSPC O
or O
Common O
Services O
Platform O
Collector O
. O
CSPC O
- O
NOS O
is O
an O
add O
- O
on O
service O
which O
is O
written O

on O
top O
of O
the O
CSPC O
i.e. O
, O
extra O
software O
written O
by O
the O
Nos O
team O
based O
on O
the O
CSPC O
2.0 O
base O

code O
to O
cater O
to O
a O
group O
of O
customers O
. O
CSPC O
- O
NOS O
support O
on O
both O
Windows O
and O
Linux O
Cent O
OS O

platform O
. O
The O
Windows O
CSPC O
- O
NOS O
client O
can O
connect O
to O
the O
CSPC O
- O
NOS O
Linux O
server O
and O
vice- O

versa O
. O
Devices O
can O
be O
added O
manually O
or O
using O
the O
import O
seed O
file O
. O
When O
importing O
a O
seed O
file/ O

When O
Device O
discovery O
is O
triggered O
the O
Device O
discovery O
module O
collects O
light O
inventory O
data O

from O
the O
devices O
. O
The O
light O
inventory O
data O
contain O
information O
like O
Sys O
Object O
I O
d O
, O
device O
family O
, O

OS O
- O
version O
etc O
. O
. O
( O
This O
information O
collected O
can O
be O
seen O
by O
going O
to O
Reports->Managed O
Devices O
) O

This O
light O
inventory O
data O
is O
used O
by O
the O
inventory O
module O
to O
load O
the O
model O
rule O
for O
the O
respective O

device O
. O
This O
data O
is O
also O
used O
by O
the O
base O
collector O
to O
decide O
whether O
the O
device O
is O
managed O

or O
unmanaged O
. O

DESCRIPTION O

IPv6 O
, O
formerly O
named O
IPng O
( O
next O
generation O
) O
, O
is O
the O
latest O
version O
of O
the O
Internet O
Protocol O
( O
IP O
) O
. O
IP O

is O
a O
packet O
- O
based O
protocol O
used O
to O
exchange O
data O
, O
voice O
, O
and O
video O
traffic O
over O
digital O
networks O

Cisco O
's O
Wide O
- O
Area O
Application O
Services O
IPv4 O
users O
can O
move O
to O
IPv6 O
and O
receive O
services O
such O

as O
end O
- O
to O
- O
end O
security O
, O
quality O
of O
service O
( O
QoS O
) O
, O
and O
globally O
unique O
addresses O
. O

address O

space O

need O
for O

addresses O
and O

Translation O
( O

) O

by O

at O

edges O
. O

in O
the O
Cisco O
IOS O
software O
consists O
of O
assigning O
IPv6 O

addresses O
to O

. O

of O

traffic O
can O

enabled O
globally O
, O

and O

for O

enabled O

for O

RELEASES O
LANCER O
, O
PHOENIX O
, O
SKYHAWK O
, O
SPRIT O

DESCRIPTION O

Wide O
Area O
Application O
Services O
( O
WAAS O
) O
is O
a O
Cisco Companies_worked_at
Systems Companies_worked_at
technology O
that O
improves O
the O

performance O
of O
applications O
on O
a O
wide O
area O
network O
( O
WAN O
) O
. O
WAAS O
combines O
Cisco O
's O
Wide O
Area O

File O
Services O
( O
WAFS O
- O
products O
allow O
remote O
office O
users O
to O
access O
and O
share O
files O
globally O
at O

LAN O
speeds O
over O
the O
WAN O
) O
with O
WAN O
optimization O
inside O
of O
a O
router O
, O
accelerating O
TCP O
- O
based O

applications O
on O
a O
given O
network O
. O

WAAS O
system O
consists O
of O
a O
set O
of O
devices O
called O
wide O
area O
application O
engines O
( O
WAEs O
) O
that O
work O

together O
to O
optimize O
TCP O
traffic O
over O
your O
network O
. O
When O
client O
and O
server O
applications O
attempt O

to O
communicate O
with O
each O
other O
, O
the O
network O
intercepts O
and O
redirects O
this O
traffic O
to O
the O
WAEs O
so O

that O
they O
can O
act O
on O
behalf O
of O
the O
client O
application O
and O
the O
destination O
server O
. O

The O
WAEs O
examine O
the O
traffic O
and O
use O
built O
- O
in O
application O
policies O
to O
determine O
whether O
to O

optimize O
the O
traffic O
or O
allow O
it O
to O
pass O
through O
your O
network O
un O
optimized O

Mainly O
involves O
optimizing O
the O
various O
Ao O
's O
like O
HTTP O
, O
SSL O
, O
HTTPS O
and O
functional O
wise O
platform O

check O
. O

WAAS(Wide O
Area O
Application O
Services O
) O

to O

Boomi O

the O

success O
factor O
and O
sterling O
systems O
. O

Boomi O
sender O
interface O

up O

from O
SF O

to O

. O

Oder O

, O

will O
be O
updated O
to O
SF O
synchronously O
. O

some O

process O

( O

process O
) O

from O

Project O

US O
EPG O
Forecast O
Workbook O
( O
FWB O
) O
application O
is O
designed O
to O

the O
US O

( O

. O

, O

. O

offline O
, O

, O
and O
changes O
to O
certain O

to O

forecast O
database O

. O

systems O
. O

Description O

project O

is O
the O

for O
telecom O
products O
. O
It O
is O

platform O
and O
has O
company O

. O
It O
has O
main O
two O
planes O
, O

management O
and O

and O
several O

sub O
modules O
. O

modules O

Module O
- O
MML O
INI O
Parser O
Tool O

MML O
is O
Configuration O
Tool O
used O
in O
communication O
equipments O

This O
Configuration O
Tool O
has O
set O
of O
default O
and O
user O
defined O
commands O
. O
INI O
Parsing O
tool O
is O
a O
tool O

which O
accepts O
MML O
Commands O
in O
certain O
grammar O
and O
generates O
Resource O
file O
and O
Binary O
File O

respectively O
which O
will O
be O
read O
by O
server O
to O

commands O

in O

, O

, O

on O
windows O
. O

Module O
- O
Man O
Machine O
Language O

MML O
is O
a O
configuration O
tool O
widely O
used O
in O
communication O
equipments O
. O
It O
uses O
Client O
/ O
Server O

architecture O
. O
MML O
server O
communicates O
with O
both O
the O
client O
and O
the O
APP O
in O
the O
equipment O
. O

It O
receives O
MML O
commands O
inputted O
by O
users O
from O
the O
client O
and O
relays O
it O
to O
APP O
to O
process O

it O
. O
After O
acquiring O
the O
processing O
result O
, O
the O
server O
generates O
a O
MML O
report O
and O
sends O
it O
back O

to O
the O
client O
. O
It O
interacts O
with O
other O
system O
modules O
. O
Connection O
Management O
, O
Authorization O

Management O
, O
Command O
Process O
, O
Data O
Synchronization O
, O
Event O
Notification O
, O

Parsing O
, O

/ O

Module O

Management O

Management O
Module O
is O

module O
of O
System O
Management O
. O
Its O
main O
function O

is O
to O
define O
specifications O
for O
configuration O
management O
interface O
between O
the O
configuration O

tool O
layer O
and O
the O
application O
layer O
, O
and O
provide O
related O
configuration O
command O
communication O

mechanism O
. O
Any O
information O
that O
can O
be O
modified O
by O
the O
user O
/ O
application O
and O
that O
affects O
the O

functionality O
of O

application O
can O

as O

data O
. O
All O
configuration O
commands O

can O

to O
Configuration O
Management O
Module O

interface O
type O
. O

Module O
- O
TL1 O

Transaction O
Language O
1 O
( O
TL1 O
) O
is O
a O
widely O
used O
, O
" O
legacy O
" O
, O
management O
protocol O
in O

telecommunications O
. O
It O
is O
a O
cross O
- O
vendor O
, O
cross O
- O
technology O
man O
- O
machine O
language O
, O
and O
is O

widely O
used O
to O
manage O
Synchronous O
Optical O
Networks O
( O
SONET O
) O
. O
It O
is O
defined O
for O
operation O

system/ O
network O
element O
( O
machine O
- O
to O
- O
machine O
) O
interfaces O
. O
TL1 O
corresponds O
to O
the O
User O
System O

Language O
( O
USL O
) O
, O
which O
is O
the O
language O
for O
human O
- O
to O
machine O
interactions O
. O
It O
is O
used O
for O
managing O

network O
elements O
in O
a O
network O
. O
TL1 O
Module O
is O
an O
interface O
between O
an O
Application O
and O
Client O
. O

Client O
sends O
the O
TL1 O
Commands O
to O
perform O
some O
configuration O
operations O
in O
the O
Applications O
. O

TL1 O
module O
process O
the O
client O
text O
TL1 O
commands O
according O
to O
standard O
specification O
TL1 O
GR O

831 O
and O
interacts O
with O
the O
Configuration O
management O
module O
and O
Convert O
Response O
messages O

back O
to O
TL1 O
Response O
messages O

Involved O
in O
development O
, O
verification O
and O
customer O
and O
release O
activities O
. O
I O
was O
a O
module O

for O
this O

. O

. O

. O

in O

form O
. O
Qx O
Module O
acts O
as O

Description O
of O
the O
project O

Wireless O
LAN O
802.11 O
describes O
MAC O
and O
PHY O
. O
Wireless O
stations O
are O
connected O
to O
form O
a O
basic O

service O
area O
which O
is O
controlled O
by O
a O
base O
station O
called O
Access O
Point O
. O
Access O
Point O
is O
a O
special O

device O
which O
basically O
acts O
as O
a O
bridge O
between O
wired O
and O
wireless O
media O
connected O
to O
a O

distributed O
system O
generally O
Ethernet O
. O
Several O
Access O
Points O
can O
be O
connected O
to O
a O
distribution O

media O
to O
form O
an O
extended O
service O
set O
. O

In O
split O
AP O
architecture O
AP O
's O
connect O
to O
a O
central O
controller O
called O
Access O
Controller O
in O
short O

AC O
. O
AP O
has O
the O
minimal O
functionalities O
such O
as O
receiving O
the O
802.11 O
data O
from O
the O
radio O
and O

forwarding O
data O
and O
management O
frames O
to O
AC O
, O
Power O
management O
, O
Advertising O
beacons O
, O

handling O
control O
frames O
. O
Management O
operations O
such O
as O
Association O
, O
Authentication O
, O
Handling O

frames O
, O
conversion O
between O
[ O
] O
802.3 O
will O
be O
done O
by O
AC O
. O

I O
was O
involved O
in O
the O
development O
of O
feature O
development O
, O
defect O
analysis O
, O
testing O
activities O
in O

the O
CLI O
, O
Frame O
handling O
, O

and O
